sentences.en: Because of his fogy ideas, Old Tom brought the house about his ears.
sentences.cn: 由于他的顽固观念, 汤姆惹得全家与他为敌.

sentences.en: I don't want to sound like I'm some old fogy.
sentences.cn: 我不想让自己听上去像一个老古董。

sentences.en: Liu Lichang is an ancient street. It is famous for old fogy.
sentences.cn: 琉璃厂是一条古老的街, 它以古董著名.

sentences.en: Somebody who was dandled on Queen Victoria's knee must appear an old fogy ( Edward, Duke of Windsor )
sentences.cn: 在维多利亚女王的膝盖上播弄的人一定看起来象守旧者 ( 爱德华温莎公爵 )

sentences.en: We cannot guarantee the punctual arrival of trains in fogy weather.
sentences.cn: 雾天我们不能保证火车准时到达.

words.tran_cn: 旧头脑的；守旧的；有些老保守似的
守旧者，老保守；抱残守缺的人

trans.tran_cn: 守旧者，赶不上时代的人
trans.tran_en: If you describe someone as a fogy or an old fogy, you mean that they are boring and old-fashioned
